settings.hero_heading:
Gisborne Airport partnering with Local Hapū
to Restore Stream Health and Create Educational Pathways for Sustainability

settings.grid-item_paragraph: Wool matting and Rolls where used for its moisture retention, weed suppression, and biodegradability. It was laid, then planted over.
The majority of plants used were nativespecies, including flax and native grasses.
Two areas across the airport which are: 1,000 + SQM

settings.heading-text-columns-separate_text_1:
Murray noticed significant improvements in weed suppression since using Wool.Life products. Ngai Tāwhiri (hapū) were particularly pleased with the natural product choice, and the airport’s landscape benefited from the aesthetically pleasing
and functional planting. Overall, Murray and his team were very satisfied with the results and plan to continue using Wool.Life products in future projects, including a car park expansion near a wetland area.
settings.heading-text-columns-separate_text_2:
Murray selected Wool.Life products due to their environmental benefits, ease of use, and the fact that they biodegrade over time, leaving no harmful residues. The team
also appreciated Wool.Life’s responsiveness and knowledge. The team at the airport specifically selected plants that wouldn’t attract birds—an important consideration for an airport, and a product that supported this was imperative.

settings.text-column_text:
“We’ve noticed significant improvements in weed suppression since using Wool.Life products.”
Murray Bell, Gisborne Airport Manager

settings.image-with-content_heading: Environmental benefits and ease of use,
settings.image-with-content_text:
Murray selected Wool.Life products due to their environmental benefits, ease of use, and the fact that they biodegrade over time, leaving no harmful residues. The team also appreciated Wool.Life’s responsiveness and knowledge.

The team at the airport specifically selected plants that wouldn’t attract birds—an important consideration for an airport, and a product that supported this was imperative.
